UNF student Anthony Tornese was on a fishing trip with his father in  when he started feeling sick PERIOD It was cancer PERIOD

Ten years later Tornese speaks for Be the Match PERIOD

Be the Match helps patients with blood cancers receive transplants to cure their sickness PERIOD

From Feb PERIOD  there will be a blood and bone marrow drive in the Student Union PERIOD

Tornese was diagnosed with Bcell lymphoma PERIOD Chuck Russell  years older than Tornese was Torneses chosen donor PERIOD

The two knew nothing about each other except age and gender PERIOD

Tornese said he received Russells bone marrow on Sept PERIOD  of that year PERIOD They call it Day Zero PERIOD

It was pretty much a waiting game from there Tonese said PERIOD

Christmas Eve of that year Tornese found out he was cancer free PERIOD

He said today he feels able to give back and raise awareness about bone marrow transplants PERIOD Tornese and Russell still keep in contact PERIOD

Katie Briggs an officer of the UNF Students Nurses Association said signing up to become a donor takes filling out some paperwork and a mouth swab PERIOD Anyone between the ages of  to  can sign up PERIOD

The preferred bone marrow age is between  and  so Briggs said she hopes a large turnout of college students will sign up at the drive PERIOD

Briggs said she wants as many people to show up as possible PERIOD Even if people who signed up are called and told they are a match they are not legally bound to donate PERIOD

Briggs said she hopes to have a Be the Match chapter on campus sometime in the future PERIOD The chapter would hold more drives like this one and would raise awareness about blood cancer PERIOD

The UNF Student Nurses Association teamed up with PRSSA and Health Promotion to bring Be the Match on campus and create this drive PERIOD
